refnamediv.refpurpose: Write vectors (to tables -or arrays of vectors).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This opcode writes vectors to tables at init time.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: vtablewi indx, ifn, ixmode, inarg1 [, inarg2, inarg3 , .... , inargN ]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: indx - Index into f-table, either a positive number range matching the table length (ixmode = 0) or a 0 to 1 range (ixmode != 0).
ixmode - index data mode. The default value is 0.
== 0 index is treated as a raw table location,

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: This opcode is useful in all cases in which one needs to write sets of values associated to unique indexes (for example, multi-channel samples, STFT bin frames, spectral formants, p-field based scores etc.). The number of elements of each vector (length of the vector) is determined by the number of optional arguments on the right (inarg1, inarg2, inarg3, .... inargN).

Notice that no wrap nor limit mode is implemented. So, if an index attempt to access to a zone not allocated by the table, Csound will probably crash. However this drawback can be easily avoided by using wrap or limit opcodes applied to indexes before using vtablewi, in order to correct eventual out-of-range values.
